definition: to figure out/to realize/to become convinced/to come round (to an idea)/to get over it
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: I had the same problem and figured it out after some goggling.
sentences.chinese: 我也有同样的问题，想通了一些突后。

sentences.english: After a serious thought, Han Jie decides to see Han Xing to offer his apology.
sentences.chinese: 经过一番思考，汉杰想通了，他决定去向汉星道歉。

sentences.english: The marquis was enlightened and knew clearly what he should do.
sentences.chinese: 昭僖候这下子想通了，清楚地知道自己应该怎么做。

sentences.english: He'll come round by and by.
Even Cuba figured this one out.
sentences.chinese: 即使古巴也早已想通这一点。

sentences.english: It means we are thinking something through.
sentences.chinese: 这说明了我们想通了一些事情，并努力地去思索。

sentences.english: Finally, there is the evolution of Yao's mind.
I would bet that you can see it that way.
sentences.chinese: 我敢说你能想通这一点。

sentences.english: Later Tour, I realized the problem.
sentences.chinese: 后来游岳庙，我才想通了问题。

definition: to figure out how to do something
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
unable to understand/unable to get over
to come to oneself/to come to realize/to come to see the truth/to wake up to reality
clear/obvious/unequivocal/to understand/to realize
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to understand clearly/evident
to understand clearly/evident
to fully grasp/to penetrate
to make sense of/to grasp the meaning of/to figure out
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment
